intro: Syzygium hartleyi, commonly known as the Hartley’s apple. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae, native to the rainforests of Queensland, Australia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature, containing a single seed. Syzygium hartleyi is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is considered a rare and endangered species.
